quarks.connectors.file

Class FileWriterFlushConfig<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • quarks.connectors.file.FileWriterFlushConfig<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - stream tuple type

    public class FileWriterFlushConfig<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    FileWriter active file flush configuration control.

    Flushing of the active file can be any combination of:

    • after every cntTuple tuples written
    • after tuplePredicate returns true
    • after periodMsec has elapsed since the last time based flush
    If nothing specific is specified, the underlying buffered writer's automatic flushing is utilized.

      • newConfig

        public static <T> FileWriterFlushConfig<T> newConfig(int cntTuples,
                                                     long periodMsec,
                                                     Predicate<T> tuplePredicate)
        Create a new configuration.

        If nothing specific is specified, the underlying buffered writer's automatic flushing is utilized.

        Parameters:
        cntTuples - flush every cntTuple tuples written. 0 to disable.
        periodMsec - flush every periodMsec milliseconds. 0 to disable.
        tuplePredicate - flush if tuplePredicate is true. null to disable.

      • getCntTuples

      • evaluate

        public boolean evaluate(int nTuples,
                        T tuple)
        Evaluate if the specified values indicate that a flush should be performed.
        Parameters:
        nTuples - number of tuples written to the active file
        tuple - the tuple written to the file
        Returns:
        true if a flush should be performed.
